intro: Tococa variegata, commonly known as the variegated tococa, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking variegated leaves, featuring a mix of green, white, and yellow hues. It produces small, pale pink flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Tococa variegata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
